DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Lymphatic mapping may improve ability detect cancer vulva . PURPOSE : This phase III trial study well lymphatic mapping work treat patient stage I stage II cancer vulva .
DOC.brief_title: Lymphatic Mapping Treating Patients With Stage I Stage II Cancer Vulva
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine negative predictive value negative sentinel lymph node patient invasive squamous cell carcinoma vulva . - Determine location sentinel node patient . OUTLINE : Patients receive injection ( ) isosulfan blue dermis junction tumor normal vulvar skin . Once afferent lymphatic channel sentinel node identify , patient undergo unilateral bilateral inguinal-femoral lymphadenectomy follow resection primary tumor adequate margin . Preoperative lymphoscintigraphy also perform . Patients follow every 3 month 2 year , every 6 month 3 year , annually thereafter recurrence . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 40-630 patient accrue study within 2-6 year .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically confirm invasive squamous cell carcinoma vulva great 1 mm thickness measure near rete peg Tumor size must 26 cm No recurrent disease Prior excision primary disease history carcinoma situ vulva allow No tumor extend urethra , anus , vagina , rectum , bladder No grossly suspicious inflame groin node physical exam No grossly infect primary tumor PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : Any age Performance status : GOG 03 Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify Other : No invasive malignancy within past 5 year except nonmelanomatous skin cancer No know hypersensitivity phenylethane compound PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : No prior cancer therapy contraindicate therapy study Biologic therapy : Not specify Chemotherapy : Not specify Endocrine therapy : Not specify Radiotherapy : Not specify Surgery : See Disease Characteristics No prior groin dissection
